name: Mutual military assistance clause in a bilateral agreement
description: Example report: senior leaders signed an agreement that includes a clause to provide assistance to each other in the event of external attack.

name: Agreement entered into force after ratification
description: Example report: the comprehensive partnership agreement entered into force following an exchange of ratification instruments.

name: Public confirmation of troop deployment to Partner State A
description: Example report: Country X confirmed it deployed personnel abroad and participated in operations in a specified region.

name: Trade rebound in 2025
description: Example report: bilateral trade increased in 2025 and approached pre-disruption levels.

name: Expiration of an expert-panel monitoring mandate
description: Example report: a veto prevented renewal of an expert-panel mandate supporting sanctions monitoring.

name: Creation of an alternative multilateral monitoring mechanism
description: Example report: a new multilateral monitoring team was established by a coalition of states to address a monitoring gap.

name: Neighbor State designated as the primary adversary (rhetorical escalation)
description: Example report: leadership called for legal or policy changes to label the neighboring state as the primary adversary.

name: Hostility embedded in constitutional or legal language
description: Example report: constitutional changes framed the neighboring state as hostile and reduced emphasis on reconciliation objectives.

name: Balloon drops carrying refuse (cross-border signaling)
description: Example report: balloons carrying refuse were sent across the border as a reciprocal signaling action.

name: GPS interference affecting civilian aviation and maritime traffic
description: Example report: GPS interference caused navigation disruptions for aircraft and vessels over a multi-day period.

name: Resumption of border-area loudspeaker broadcasts
description: Example report: border-area broadcasts resumed, contributing to an intensified information contest dynamic.

name: Estimate of warhead count and fissile material stock
description: Example assessment: Country X likely possesses a set number of warheads and enough fissile material for a larger potential total.

name: Multiple-warhead strategic missiles as a growth vector
description: Example assessment: multiple-warhead systems provide a significant pathway to expand nuclear strike capacity.

name: Solid-fuel ICBMs
description: Example assessment: solid-fuel ICBMs were likely introduced after a specified milestone date.

name: Tactical nuclear-capable systems
description: Example assessment: tactical nuclear-capable systems were likely fielded after a specified milestone date.

name: New large surface combatant under construction
description: Example assessment: imagery suggests Country X is building its largest surface combatant to date.

name: Unmanned systems and electronic warfare investment
description: Example report: Country X expanded investment in reconnaissance/strike drones and electronic warfare as part of modernization.

name: Transfers of equipment and reciprocal support
description: Example report: transfers included conventional munitions and missile-related items, while Partner State A provided air-defense-related support.

name: Refined petroleum products exceeding a formal cap
description: Example report: deliveries of refined petroleum products exceeded an established annual limit.

name: Operational experience and training abroad
description: Example report: personnel received training with Partner State A’s forces over an extended period.

name: Estimated GDP growth in 2024
description: Example estimate: Country X’s real GDP grew by a reported percentage in 2024.

name: Growth in trade with Partner State B (2025)
description: Example report: trade with Partner State B increased in 2025.

name: Suspected illicit exports of restricted commodities
description: Example assessment: satellite imagery indicates continued exports of restricted commodities in potential violation of international restrictions, generating substantial revenue.

name: Correspondent banking links supporting restricted transactions
description: Example report: Partner State A maintained correspondent banking relationships supporting sanctions-evasion activity.

name: Identified channel for laundering proceeds from illicit cyber activity
description: Example filing: a group was described as a channel for laundering funds associated with illicit cyber activity.

name: Failed satellite launch attempt (May 2024)
description: Example report: an attempted reconnaissance satellite launch failed due to a mid-flight explosion.

name: Satellite orbit adjustments indicating partial operational capability
description: Example expert assessment: a satellite demonstrated the ability to maneuver, indicating functional command-and-control links.

name: Improved logistics at a launch site (pier/infrastructure)
description: Example report: a new pier was completed at a rocket launch site, supporting future launch operations.

name: Assessment of external engine/technology support
description: Example report: an intelligence service assessed that components used in a launch attempt may have originated from Partner State A.

name: Partner State A force training provided to Country X personnel
description: Example report: Partner State A forces provided training to Country X personnel deployed abroad.

name: Sanctions basis: initial resolution and subsequent measures
description: Example report: sanctions resolutions adopted since 2006 are described as legally binding for member states.

name: Neighbor State suspended parts of a 2018 military agreement
description: Example report: Neighbor State announced suspension of parts of a prior military agreement following cross-border incidents.

name: Severing border infrastructure following legal-policy changes
description: Example report: Country X destroyed or removed parts of road/rail links after adopting a hardened legal-policy stance toward the neighbor.
